location: Located at J.P. Rizal Street, Zone II
about: Barangay Rizal used to be a panorama of chirping birds and flattering trees where farming activities thrived. Now, it is one of the highly developed barangays in the city of Makati. Its origin dated back to the height of the EDSA revolution. When Pres. Corazon C. Aquino rose to power in 1986, she repeatedly pronounced the distribution of land to the landless as a major policy of her government. Fired up by this procurement, people from different places in Metro Manila began occupying the land in the guise of people power. In this light, Mayor Jejomar C. Binay of the Municipality of Makati saw it proper to subdivide the land in Barangay Pembo and awarded the same to his landless and homeless constituents. Helped along by the technical expertise of Engr. Ernesto Mercado of the Medina Survey group, the distribution of lots was completed in the same year.
mission: To meet this noble end, we shall provide our constituents with services in the highest possible degree of promptness sensitive to their primary needs. We shall undertake programs and projects that will address poverty, prevent occurrence of crimes and illegal activities, uplift the quality of community life and in so doing make our barangay a channel of rich opportunities. We shall also explore other means or resources to enhance our local and global competitiveness
vision: A leading barangay in the City of Makati dedicated to deliver effective and efficient public service to its constituents with a sense of professionalism, honesty and fairness.  A peaceful, healthy and safe community with ample livelihood opportunities and professional growth and a sound environment that fosters cooperation, volunteerism and hope.

props.name: Topography
props.value: Although Makati City has a generally flat topography, Barangay Rizal sits on solid undulating tuffaceous plain. Slope characteristics are moderately undulating and rolling and land sloping in several directions.
